snippet: Humanitarian groups are warning of a looming disaster in the former French colony, where Seleka rebels have been looting, raping and killing, and coups have outnumbered fair elections.
abstract: Unrest in Central African Republic, where violent coups have outnumbered fair elections four to one since independence, has humanitarian groups warning of looming disaster of widespread malnutrition and disease; economy has shutdown, aid has stopped, international aid workers have fled the countryside and violence outside the capital has prevented farmers from tending their crops.
lead_paragraph: Humanitarian groups are warning of a looming disaster in the former French colony, where Seleka rebels have been looting, raping and killing, and coups have outnumbered fair elections.

headline.main: Violent and Chaotic, Central African Republic Lurches Toward a Crisis
headline.print_headline: A Violent, Chaotic Land Lurches Toward Crisis

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
